result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Lynn Cyr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rebecca Lynn Cyr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rebecca Lynn Cyr was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Rebecca Lynn Cyr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Iron County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay $10 per month commencing September 1, 2017 and due the 1st of every month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to make court ordered payments will result in termination of payment plan and all available enforcement actions will be taken without further notice.
Defendant shall recieve credit for time spent in residential treatment.  Court deems jail sentence served.

Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: No further sentence.  Sentence listed on Count #3.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Lynn Cyr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Sam Joseph Filippo in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rebecca Lynn Cyr appeared by phone means.   DA calls 16CF22 and 16CM50 at 10:36 a.m.  Cites appearances.  DA states agreement.  Def pleads NC to Count 3 and 4 in 16CF22 and to sole Count in 16CM50.  Sentence to be $25 fine plus costs.  Credit for 8 months in residential treatment so no further jail.  Atty Filippo agrees as stated.  Court accepts pleas and finds guilty.  Imposes $25 plus costs on Count #3 in 16CF22.  DNA sample to be given, surcharge imposes.  Also 8 months in Iron County jail with credit for all time served.  No further jail requirement.  $484.50 is total obligation to be paid at $10 per month.  No other sentence on 16CM50 or Count #4.  Adj.  10:41 a.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Sam J. Filippo appeared on behalf of def who was not present.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 12:15 p.m.  Requests case to be rescheduled in 30 days.  Sam concurs.  Court accepts request for continuance.  Adj. 12:17 p.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2017 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rebecca Lynn Cyr in court with attorney Sam Joseph Filippo.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing and reading of the complaint.  Court accepts waiver and preserves right to prelim but waives time limits.  PTC to be scheduled.  Bond is now an omnibus bond for both cases.  Court is acceptible to making changes to bond if needed to allow def to go to treatment.  Defendant also pleads NG to all misdemeanor charges.  klr
Initial appearance on July 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
